content.description:
PROSECUTIONS FOR WITCHCRAFT IN EUROPE, BY DECADE

Source: Adapted from: Peter Leeson and Jacob Russ, “Witch Trials,” The Economic Journal, Volume 128 (August 2017), p. 2081.
content.question: The patterns in the graph most strongly support which of the following conclusions about witchcraft prosecutions in the early modern period?

choices.label: Witchcraft prosecutions are closely associated with economic stress.
Witchcraft prosecutions are closely associated with religious conflict.
Witchcraft prosecutions are closely associated with state centralization.
Witchcraft prosecutions are closely associated with immigration.

content.answer: Witchcraft prosecutions are closely associated with religious conflict.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
